page.title: 06A FARM LABOURER
page.content: A FARM LABOURER'S WAGES FOR A SIX DAY WEEK(7.AM-4.PM) WAS Â£1.5O.HE LOOKED AFTER AND USED A TEAM OF UP TO 4 HORSES.THE HEAVY HORSES _ SHIRES,SUFFOLK PUNCH,PERCHERONS , COULD BE BOUGHT FOR Â£30 ,A PLOUGH FOR Â£1.50. USING A DOUBLE PLOUGH AND A TEAM OF THREE HORSES A MAN COULD PLOUGH ONE AND A HALF ACRES A DAY. NOW USING TRACTORS HE COULD PLOUGH TWENTY ACRES. THE LABOURER WE MET HAS LIVED IN GRESHAM ALL HIS LIFE. HE THINKS TODAYS METHODS ARE MORE EFFICIENT. HE BELIEVES MECHANISATION HAS LED TO FEWER FARM WORKERS. THE VILLAGE HAD SEVEN TRADESMEN AND TWO BRICKLAYING YARDS. NOW NONE OF THESE REMAIN. {JOANNA PEARL, CHARLOTTE SAYER AND {MELANIE DETNON}. {
